content:
• Tuesday, December 4, 2012
  • SEAC

    More on SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q3 beats across the board, despite a dip in total...

    More on SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q3 beats across the board, despite a dip in total sales Y/Y. Net profit rose a solid 42% as the video-gear maker's operating costs decreased and offset the weaker sales numbers. Operating expenses shrank 13% to $20M, on lower R&D, marketing, overhead costs and earn-outs. Gross margin narrowed however, to 49.7% from 56.6%. For FY13, the company ups guidance, now seeing earnings of $0.38 to $0.41 on revenue of $155M to $159M. The Street view is for an EPS of $0.34 on $156M in revenue. Shares +5.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 PM
  • ANIK

    Anika Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ANIK) says it's received correspondence from the FDA's Chief...

    Anika Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ANIK) says it's received correspondence from the FDA's Chief Scientific Officer of the Center for Devices and Radiological Health upholding the agency's previously disclosed, non-approvable decision for ANIK's Monovisc PMA. ANIK had utilized the FDA’s appeal process to continue to discuss the Monovisc PMA with the FDA, and plans to schedule a meeting as soon as possible to determine the next steps. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • AVAV

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AVAV +10%. AMRS +7%. STMP +5%. ESL +4%. CTSH...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AVAV +10%. AMRS +7%. STMP +5%. ESL +4%. CTSH +4%.
    After-hours top losers: MFRM -22%. MIND -21%. P -18%. TIBX -13%. OXM -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • MFRM

    More on Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): Q3 beats on both a per share and a revenue basis as total...

    More on Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): Q3 beats on both a per share and a revenue basis as total sales rose by 51% Y/Y. Net profit grew by 1.2% as comparable-store sales growth rose 6.6% for the quarter. However, the company noted that sales traffic had slowed in November, it was reducing FY13 guidance. It now expects its EPS to come in the range of $1.49 - $1.52 on revenues of between $1.01B - $1.015B. This is down from the prior range of $1.022B - $1.039B, and below consensus estimates for an EPS of $1.69 on revenue of $1.024B. Shares -22% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • LYB

    LyondellBasell (NYSE:LYB) -2.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 21M common shares by...

    LyondellBasell (NYSE:LYB) -2.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 21M common shares by certain selling shareholders that are affiliates of Apollo Management Holdings. LYB will receive no proceeds from the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) craters in spite of announcing positive preliminary results...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) craters in spite of announcing positive preliminary results for Study 306B, a Phase III trial of Northera, a treatment for hypotension associated with Parkinson's Disease, saying the trial met its primary endpoint. The devil lies in the details however, as investors react to the results under the shadow of the FDA's earlier statement that the trial was unlikely to provide sufficient confirmatory evidence to support an NDA. Shares -22% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • TIBX

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) -14.7% AH after warning it expects to report FQ4 (ended Nov. 30) revenue of...

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) -14.7% AH after warning it expects to report FQ4 (ended Nov. 30) revenue of $292M-$295M and EPS of $0.37-$0.38, below a consensus of $316M and $0.44. Tibco blames a mix of soft government spending, Sandy-related deal delays, and poor execution in its infrastructure (i.e. middleware) business, particularly in the Americas. The FQ4 report arrives on Dec. 20. It could be a rough day for enterprise software stocks tomorrow: QLIK -3.7%. PRGS -1.4%. RHT -2.3%. INFA -1.1%. CTXS -1%. ORCL -0.9%. SAP -0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • OAK

    Oaktree Capital (OAK +3.3%) gains after Howard Marks attempts to set things straight at his...

    Oaktree Capital (OAK +3.3%) gains after Howard Marks attempts to set things straight at his Goldman conference presentation. Carry has little value? The reality, says Marks, is Oaktree has $1.3B in accrued net carry, about $8.50/share. Worth a read and a listen.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • INTC

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) -2.7% AH after guiding on its mid-quarter update for an 8%-10% Q/Q drop in...

    Altera (NASDAQ:ALTR) -2.7% AH after guiding on its mid-quarter update for an 8%-10% Q/Q drop in Q4 revenue, worse than prior guidance for a 6%-10% drop. The FPGA maker is also guiding for a 2013 gross margin of 69%-70%, in-line with the 69.3% margin Altera reported for Q3, and for 2013 R&D spending of $404M, up 12% from expected 2012 R&D spending of roughly $360M. CC at 4:45 PM ET (webcast). Xilinx (NASDAQ:XLNX) -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • ASYS

    Amtech Systems (NASDAQ:ASYS): FQ4 EPS of -$1.49 misses by $0.97. Revenue of $10.9M misses by...

    Amtech Systems (NASDAQ:ASYS): FQ4 EPS of -$1.49 misses by $0.97. Revenue of $10.9M misses by $1.7M. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ2 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $80.3M (flat% Y/Y)...

    AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV): FQ2 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.16. Revenue of $80.3M (flat% Y/Y) beats by $3.3M. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • P

    More on Pandora: FQ4 guidance is for revenue of $120M-$123M and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.09, below a...

    More on Pandora: FQ4 guidance is for revenue of $120M-$123M and EPS of -$0.06 to -$0.09, below a consensus of $130.3M and $0.02. No explanation is given. FQ3 mobile revenue was $73.9M, +25% Q/Q and +112% Y/Y. Active listeners rose by 4.3M Q/Q to 59.2M. Listener hours +67% Y/Y and content costs +75%, exceeding revenue growth of 60%. Mobile 62% of revenue vs. over 3/4 of listening time. P -21.9% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast), expect questions about the gap between mobile and PC ad rates to figure prominently. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • BC

    Brunswick (NYSE:BC) names William Metzger as its new CFO. Most recently treasurer of the...

    Brunswick (NYSE:BC) names William Metzger as its new CFO. Most recently treasurer of the company, succeeding Peter Hamilton, who is retiring in February 2013. Metzger will report to chairman and CEO Dustan McCoy. The change will take effect in March. Shares -1.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • SEAC

    SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q3 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $39.2M (-8.6%...

    SeaChange International (NASDAQ:SEAC): Q3 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $39.2M (-8.6% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • P

    Pandora Media (NYSE:P): Q3 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $120M (+60% Y/Y) beats by...

    Pandora Media (NYSE:P): Q3 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $120M (+60% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -21.1% AH. (PR)

  • MFRM

    Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): Q3 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $277.3M (+51.1% Y/Y)...

    Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM): Q3 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $277.3M (+51.1% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares -11.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM

  • Medical device provider Edwards Lifesciences (EW +5.7%) finishes strong after offering a bullish...

    Medical device provider Edwards Lifesciences (EW +5.7%) finishes strong after offering a bullish estimate for 2013, mostly ahead of Street views. The firm cites strong sales growth expectations, fueled by the ongoing launch of its Sapien transcatheter heart valve in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ACHC

    Acadia Healthcare (ACHC -2.5%) meanders around its lows for the day after unveiling a 9.6M share...

    Acadia Healthcare (ACHC -2.5%) meanders around its lows for the day after unveiling a 9.6M share offering as the behavioral-health services company looks to raise proceeds to fund acquisitions. The company currently has a float of around 42M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • CLB

    Core Labs (CLB +2.9%) is initiated with a Buy rating at Global Hunter on the basis of the global...

    Core Labs (CLB +2.9%) is initiated with a Buy rating at Global Hunter on the basis of the global oil market's growing reliance on unconventional and deepwater production and CLB's status as a go-to provider of dynamic reservoir characterization. The stock isn't particularly cheap, but the firm likes its consistent track record of generating top returns on capital relative to peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • LGND

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND -2.3%) trades lower after guiding its FY13 estimates below Street...

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND -2.3%) trades lower after guiding its FY13 estimates below Street consensus at its Analyst Day earlier this morning. The company now expects earn around $0.35 per share on revenue of $41M to $44M, below analysts estimates of $0.43 on $45M. (Webcast replay)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • UEPS

    Shares of Net 1 UEPS Technologies (UEPS -60.7%) plunge on news the Department of Justice...

    Shares of Net 1 UEPS Technologies (UEPS -60.7%) plunge on news the Department of Justice and FBI are investigating the company over possible bribes to the South African government in connection with a contract for social welfare and benefits payments. In an SEC filing, UEPS says the probe is tied to statements it made in its regulatory filings regarding the contract.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • GPS

    Piper Jaffray comes to the defense of Gap (GPS -9.9%) after shares tumbled on concerns about...

    Piper Jaffray comes to the defense of Gap (GPS -9.9%) after shares tumbled on concerns about holiday sales and the level of promotional activity fired up by the retailer. The firm says it's more than happy to dip in with Gap's shares down close to 9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP -0.4%) and Regency Energy Partners (RGP -2.2%) announce early...

    Energy Transfer Partners (ETP -0.4%) and Regency Energy Partners (RGP -2.2%) announce early completion of their joint pipeline project to take natural gas liquids from west Texas to the Mont Belvieu gathering hub in the east of the state. The Lone Star West Texas Gateway NGL Pipeline will have an initial capacity of 209K bbl/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • ASH

    Ashland (ASH +3.8%) shares power higher after the company reveals at its Analyst Day projections...

    Ashland (ASH +3.8%) shares power higher after the company reveals at its Analyst Day projections for FY 2014 EBITDA of $1.7B vs. analyst consensus estimate of $1.57B and EPS of $9.50-$10.50 vs. consensus of $8.94. ASH expects strong sales growth in Q1, but wind markets remain depressed due to protracted softness in Europe and slow recovery in China.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • FWONA

    Shares of Liberty Media (LMCA -5%) slump after the Netflix-Disney deal is announced. Traders are...

    Shares of Liberty Media (LMCA -5%) slump after the Netflix-Disney deal is announced. Traders are betting the partnership will be negative for LMCA property Starz.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK +5.5%) has shot higher in afternoon trading, apparently thanks to a Bloomberg report...

    Nokia (NOK +5.5%) has shot higher in afternoon trading, apparently thanks to a Bloomberg report the company will soon announce a deal to sell a Lumia 920 variant to China Mobile (NYSE:CHL) that will support the latter's TD-SCDMA 3G network. However, this is old news: China Mobile announced it would sell the phone, known as the Lumia 920T, back in October. The fact China Mobile still doesn't have an iPhone deal could give 920T sales a boost.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 43 Comments
  • WINT

    Discovery Laboratories (DSCO +4.9%) moves up today after releasing data from a new...

    Discovery Laboratories (DSCO +4.9%) moves up today after releasing data from a new pharmacoeconomic analysis demonstrating that the previously-reported reduced rate of reintubation in preterm infants treated with Surfaxin may also result in an average potential hospital cost savings of $389,247 per 100 treated infants by reducing the frequency of bronchopulmonary dysplasia.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • CTRP

    A few more Chinese tech names that appear to be casualties of the SEC's lawsuits against the...

    A few more Chinese tech names that appear to be casualties of the SEC's lawsuits against the Chinese units of the Big-4 accounting firms: CTRP -9.9%. DANG -5.3%. CYOU -7.6%. NQ -4.8%. LDK -4.9%. STP -5.4%  (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 1 Comment

    Mercer International (MERC -3%) slides today after announcing it's filed a universal shelf...

    Mercer International (MERC -3%) slides today after announcing it's filed a universal shelf registration with the SEC, and a shelf prospectus with certain Canadian securities regulators to sell up to $500M of debt securities, common stock, preferred stock and warrants.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +7.4%) roar higher the company announces a licensing agreement with...

    Shares of Netflix (NFLX +7.4%) roar higher the company announces a licensing agreement with Disney that will see the company receive first-run content from the media giant for several years.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • CYCC

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (CYCC +17.3%) pops today after announcing earlier that it will present...

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (CYCC +17.3%) pops today after announcing earlier that it will present analysis of Phase III testing of its leukemia drug candidates Sapacitabine and Decitabine. The testing was administered in alternating cycles in elderly patients with newly diagnosed acute myeloid leukemia at American Society of Hemoatology convention in Atlanta this weekend.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • INFN

    Infinera (INFN +3.7%) is trading higher after announcing CenturyLink (NYSE:CTL) will deploy its...

    Infinera (INFN +3.7%) is trading higher after announcing CenturyLink (NYSE:CTL) will deploy its high-end DTN-X optical transmission/switching systems on its nationwide fiber network. Infinera boasts the DTN-X offers unmatched density and power savings thanks to its use of proprietary 500 Gb/s DWDM line card circuits. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • GPS

    Shares of Gap (GPS -8.1%) drop like a rock after reports crop up indicating the company will...

    Shares of Gap (GPS -8.1%) drop like a rock after reports crop up indicating the company will pass on making a special dividend payout to shareholders this year to catch lower tax rates. With the move sounding overdone, other traders say cautious comments from Nomura on Gap's holiday sales are also tipping sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -1.6%) appears to be the restaurant stock seeing the most collateral...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD -1.6%) appears to be the restaurant stock seeing the most collateral damage from an uninspiring cut in guidanace from Darden Restaurants. Despite a disconcerting 19% off of October's high share price, BWLD has plenty of bulls touting the growth story although Hedgeye's Howard Penney doesn't appear to be one of them. The retail analyst warns on the chaos from the restaurant chain's price hike and tips the stock to see more downside.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • SCMP

    Shares of Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (SCMP -4.4%) extend yesterday's slide on the back of the FDA's...

    Shares of Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (SCMP -4.4%) extend yesterday's slide on the back of the FDA's reveiw extension of the company's Amitiza drug to treat opioid-induced constipation in patients with chronic, noncancer pain.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • TUWLF

    Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWLF -4.5%) tumbles on news its Zaedyus-2 appraisal well offshore French...

    Tullow Oil (OTCPK:TUWLF -4.5%) tumbles on news its Zaedyus-2 appraisal well offshore French Guiana completed drilling but failed to encounter commercial hydrocarbons. The well was drilled in the Guyane Maritime license, where Tullow owns a 27.5% stake and is partnered by Shell (RDS.A, RDS.B), the operator and holding a 45% stake, Total (NYSE:TOT) and others.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • SINO

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTCPK:ALDA +54%. SINO +29%. CYCC +17%. LTBR +12%. CORT +12%. SAB-OLD...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTCPK:ALDA +54%. SINO +29%. CYCC +17%. LTBR +12%. CORT +12%. SAB-OLD +11%. EDMC +10%. CPGI +11%. PRIS +10%. ACLS +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: UEPS -56%. GERN -24%. EXA -22%. CUR -20%. SSN -19%. PPHM -16%. IQNT -18%. PBY-OLD -14%. GURE -12%. LEDS -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • VOLC

    Medical device manufacturer Volcano Corp. (VOLC -5.1%) slides today after announcing its...

    Medical device manufacturer Volcano Corp. (VOLC -5.1%) slides today after announcing its intention to offer $350M in convertible senior notes due December 1, 2017, with an additional $52M to cover over-allotments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • IRIX

    Iridex Corporation (IRIX +1%) gains after saying late yesterday that the FDA has granted...

    Iridex Corporation (IRIX +1%) gains after saying late yesterday that the FDA has granted clearance of its TxCell Scanning Laser Delivery System. The system is designed to enhance laser photocoagulation procedures and allow physicians to operate the laser in a multi-spot scanning mode, which is a more efficient method for these procedures than the traditional single spot mode.  

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • CWST

    Casella Waste Systems (CWST -4.5%) slips after missing on its FQ2 results yesterday, and saying...

    Casella Waste Systems (CWST -4.5%) slips after missing on its FQ2 results yesterday, and saying that it's reshuffling its management ranks. Net losses widened on debt-related losses, as earnings were negatively impacted by difficult economic conditions. Recycling commodity prices, landfill volumes at its Western New York landfills and its roll-off collection line-of-business all contributed to underperformance. The company lowers its FY13 sales outlook from $475M - 485M to $468M - 478M. Street estimates were at $475M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • PTNR

    Partner Communications (PTNR +3.7%) has rallied after receiving a two-notch upgrade to Buy from...

    Partner Communications (PTNR +3.7%) has rallied after receiving a two-notch upgrade to Buy from BofA/Merrill. The upgrade comes just after media tycoon Haim Saban reached a deal to buy a 30.7% stake in the Israeli mobile carrier from holding firm Scailex.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +1.9%) reports it had an average of 206 drilling rigs operating,...

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +1.9%) reports it had an average of 206 drilling rigs operating, including 198 rigs in the U.S. and eight in Canada, during November. PTEN says it intends to continue providing monthly updates on drilling rigs operating shortly after the end of each month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • DSW

    Shares of DSW (DSW +3.4%) are on the rise on chatter indicating Leonard Green has set its sights...

    Shares of DSW (DSW +3.4%) are on the rise on chatter indicating Leonard Green has set its sights on the retailer. The P-E firm tried to shield prying eyes from seeing the position it has been building in DSW.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • GERN

    Geron (GERN -28.5%) gets slammed this morning after the drug developer announced late yesterday...

    Geron (GERN -28.5%) gets slammed this morning after the drug developer announced late yesterday that it has stopped developing its treatment for brain cancers and will cut its workforce by 40% and replace its CFO. Along with the fundamental knock, the stock also has broken through key technical support and is setting a new 10-year low.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • AAP

    Auto parts sellers slump after AutoZone's earnings report set a dour tone. Though Advance Auto...

    Auto parts sellers slump after AutoZone's earnings report set a dour tone. Though Advance Auto Parts (AAP -1.5%) and O'Reilly (ORLY -0.9%) trade lower, it's shares of Pep Boys (PBY-OLD -12.4%) that are really getting clobbered after the company showed weak results of its own for Q3. The sector isn't getting any help from a mild start to the winter, but underlying service and merchandise sales trends are worrisome.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • HNT

    Health Net (HNT +5.5%) takes an early lead out of the gate this morning on an upgrade to...

    Health Net (HNT +5.5%) takes an early lead out of the gate this morning on an upgrade to Outperform at Wells Fargo. The firm says the health insurer has dealt with most of the challenges it has faced in 2012 and has a number of positive catalysts to propel it higher over the near term, including growth opportunities in California, along with its recently signed agreement with the DHCS.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • BIDU

    Some marquee Chinese Internet stocks are slumping, potentially on worries about the SEC's suits...

    Some marquee Chinese Internet stocks are slumping, potentially on worries about the SEC's suits against the Chinese arms of the Big-4 U.S. accounting firms. Baidu (BIDU -5.1%), Sina (SINA -6.6%), Youku Tudou (YOKU -4.2%), Sohu (SOHU -3%), Perfect World (PWRD -1.2%), and NetEase (NTES -4%) are among the losers. Renren (RENN +2.5%) is higher following yesterday afternoon's Deutsche upgrade.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 2 Comments
  • IAC

    InterActiveCorp (IACI -8.2%) and Demand Media (DMD -7.3%) dive after Goldman downgrades both to...

    InterActiveCorp (IACI -8.2%) and Demand Media (DMD -7.3%) dive after Goldman downgrades both to Sell on worries about rising search ad expenses due to competition for keywords that redirect users to search pages on their Ask.com and eHow sites. Also, concerns raised about possible Google policy changes (previous) restricting such practices, and Ask.com's traffic, something investors are already on edge over. Search accounts for 52% of IAC's revenue, and Demand depends heavily on Google traffic. AOL (AOL -3.7%) is also considered at risk to an extent.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • CECO

    Shares of Career Education (CECO -2.1%) slump after Wells Fargo analyst Trace Urdan downgrades...

    Shares of Career Education (CECO -2.1%) slump after Wells Fargo analyst Trace Urdan downgrades the stock to Market Perform from Outperform. The analyst see results taking a hit from increased costs as the company closes campuses.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -1.8%) is under investigation over whether or not the electric vehicle...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -1.8%) is under investigation over whether or not the electric vehicle automaker used its foreign trade zone status to bypass requirements that it buy parts from American companies. Though the issue will draw attention with Tesla a bit of a political lightning rod, a tweet from Elon Musk indicating the company was narrowly cash flow positive last week could balance sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 10 Comments
  • DAL

    Airline stocks trade higher with oil prices easing off and more M&A talk swirling around...

    Airline stocks trade higher with oil prices easing off and more M&A talk swirling around following news from yesterday that Virgin Atlantic was up for sale. Another underlying factor to watch in the sector is if European or U.S. regulators relax on foreign ownership rules to put a charge into consolidation plans. Advancers: DAL +2.9%, LUV +1.5%, UAL +1.4%, LCC +1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +4%) and Synacor (SYNC +1.9%) open higher after the companies strike a deal that...

    Zynga (ZNGA +4%) and Synacor (SYNC +1.9%) open higher after the companies strike a deal that gives Synacor's pay-TV industry customers the option to offer Zynga's games on their portal homepages, and to include Zynga virtual currency in their subscription bundles. Synacor's customer base includes Verizon, Time Warner Cable, and CenturyLink. Recent Facebook-related developments (I, II) make it easier for Zynga to expand its horizons, and arguably give it some motivation to do so.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • BIG

    Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) announces that CEO Steven Fishman will retire as soon as a successor is...

    Big Lots (NYSE:BIG) announces that CEO Steven Fishman will retire as soon as a successor is appointed. The company has been mired in a sales slump, with this morning's Q3 earnings release tipping off more of the same. Shares of BIG, +7.1% premarket, are on a rush off the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS) -7.2% after 3 sources tell Reuters Sprint (NYSE:S) is unlikely to make an offer...

    MetroPCS (PCS) -7.2% after 3 sources tell Reuters Sprint (NYSE:S) is unlikely to make an offer for the discount carrier in the near-term, out of concern it would complicate the regulatory review of the SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) deal. Sprint could revisit a MetroPCS bid after the SoftBank deal closes, but with the T-Mobile/MetroPCS deal expected to close somewhere in 1H13, and Sprint and SoftBank shooting for a mid-2013 close, Sprint might not have much time. LEAP -1.6%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are just about holding on to small gains, while London and...

    Market preview: Stock futures are just about holding on to small gains, while London and Frankfurt have turned lower after rising earlier. The S&P benchmark is +0.1%. The market continues to remain hostage to the ebb and flow of the fiscal cliff talks. The focus should turn to Baxter after it says it's buying Gambro for $4B, while Toll Brothers jumps 4.1% following earnings, although MetroPCS is -6.9% after Sprint appears to lose interest. Later: Daniel Tarullo
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • SINO

    Premarket gainers: SINO +28%. GALE +14%. FHCO +10%. BIG +7%. OCZ +6%. ALXA +5%. Losers: GERN...

    Premarket gainers: SINO +28%. GALE +14%. FHCO +10%. BIG +7%. OCZ +6%. ALXA +5%.
    Losers: GERN -28%. PBY-OLD -9%. DRI -9%. SSN -6.4%. PCS -6.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM

    The restaurant sector is on watch after a profit warning from Darden Restaurants points to...

    The restaurant sector is on watch after a profit warning from Darden Restaurants points to weakness, not in Europe or China, but at home in the U.S. While increased promotional activity in the sector is behind part of the slip from Darden, the bigger question is why are sales so weak for big players if consumer confidence is supposedly bouncing back?

  • MLCO

    Gaming companies with operations in Macau are feeling the pressure in early trading from reports...

    Gaming companies with operations in Macau are feeling the pressure in early trading from reports on a crackdown by Chinese authorities on corruption. Though a few token arrests is considered the same old song and dance by a number of industry watchers, it's the pace of revenue growth in the region that is the larger story to watch for them. For November, Macau gaming grew at 7.9% vs. a consensus estimate of 8%. Premarket: MPEL -4.5%, WYNN -1.5%, MGM inactive, LVS -1.8%.

  • OSK

    Carl Icahn loses his second attempt to acquire control of Oshkosh (OSK -3.5%) after just 22% of...

    Carl Icahn loses his second attempt to acquire control of Oshkosh (OSK -3.5%) after just 22% of shares were tendered following his $32.50/share offer. Icahn had wanted to receive at least 25%, which he thought would give him a better chance of overhauling Oshkosh's board. He will now return all the tendered shares, although he is still the company's largest shareholder with a 9.5% stake.

    Galena (GALE) soars 17.2% after signing a deal with Teva (NYSE:TEVA) for the commercialization of its NeuVax breast cancer treatment in Israel. While financial terms weren't disclosed, Teva will make significant royalty payments to Galena on future sales. Israel will be the location of at least four sites for Phase 3 trials of NeuVax.
